state.text: I only started coming here as a bit of a getaway from the stress of college life, but I am looking to become a regular here soon!
While not a Christmas date, I have been Christmas camping with my friends! While not necessarily romantic, it was nice to spend time with everyone!

case.state: I'm from Minobu, in Japan's Yamanashi Prefecture. It's a beautiful spot, and it's right next to Lake Motosu, and Mount Fuji!

state.text: My dream is a little strange, but I want to go camping on every continent! Though, maybe not Antarctica...
Happy Birthday Petra! I hope we can make your birthday a pleasant and comfy one.
That sounds delicious... Perhaps some s'mores would be up your alley? Chocolate and Marshmallows, in between 2 graham crackers make for a sweet treat...
Happy Birthday Miku! I can't believe I'm getting to celebrate it with you! This feels like such an honor...

I don't own a pet, but my friend Ena has a Chihuahua named Chikuwa. I love getting to play with him whenever I see her!

Snacks?! That's an easy answer: Curry noodles! Nothing beats them!

Without a doubt, I'd wish for the best camping supplies money could buy! I could take them out in just about any weather, and they'd still be just as new as when I got them!

I could share stories of my countless camping adventures, but I've had so many, it's a little hard to pick one out! There are a couple standouts though...
Oh, there's so many to choose from! There's Mount Fuji, Lake Motosu, the geospots around Izu, the Ooi River, and not to mention, all the wonderful hot springs!
Well, I've made it no secret that I love going camping. That being said, I also love cooking! There's just something so rewarding about preparing your own dishes!
I'm really good at cooking! I've cooked just about everything on the camping trips I've been on, and I also cook for myself at home!

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! My first "camping trip" was on Lake Motosu, when I first moved into Yamanashi. I had biked to see Mt. Fuji, but fell asleep at a rest stop on the way. My friend Rin discovered me, and I got to see Fuji-san for the first time that night, and that's what got me into camping!

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! Rin and I went on a camping trip to Lake Shibire, where I encountered Toba Sensei and her sister camping as well. They helped us out of a camping jam, and we got to share a meal together!

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! A few years ago, me and the rest of my friends went on a camping trip to Izu. This trip coincided my and my friend Aoi's birthday, so we celebrated it at the end of our trip! It was one of most memorable camping experiences I ever had...

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! Me and my friends Rin and Ayano went on a camping trip to the Ooi River, which has a railway full of cute, retro trains. We were on a bridge, when we all saw a steam locomotive rush by! I didn't get a picture, but it was amazing!

Fate, I promised you a story earlier, so here's one of my favorites! The last time me and my friends went camping together was on the lake a couple summers ago. While we were there, we got to watch fireworks light the sky. It was great to have one last trip before we went to college!
I do! I take a lot of walks around my college campus, and there's always something pretty to see!
I tend to use my bike for short-distance trips, which is good for exercise. On longer distance trips, however, I'll usually take a train.
As a camping extraordinaire, I love being around nature! Forests, lakes, fields, I love it all!

case.state: Happy Birthday to me...
Guess what?! Today's my birthday! I'm really glad I'm getting to spend it with all of you today!
I used to live by the sea with my friend Ayano, so the sound of crashing waves make me feel at home.

Just getting to be by the lake brings back so many good memories. The forest surrounding it reminds me of when me and my friend Rin camped on Lake Shibire. {small}(I just hope this lake doesn't have a demon bull hiding in it.){!reset}

Just getting to be by the lake brings back so many good memories. I recall looking across Lake Motosu at Mount Fuji for the first time, and how magical that was, seeing it glow in the light of night...

Being here reminds me of when I got to go Christmas camping with all my closest friends. It was the first time Rin had gone camping with the whole group, and it made the experience all the more special!

Hi Nord! I'm glad you're taking a break to come and play with us. I know you've been really busy, so don't feel afraid to relax every once in awhile. It makes a world of difference!
My friend Rin used to come to our old school library a lot. She found it a nice, quiet place to read, or to simply relax after a busy school day. Though, it was never as fancy as this!

I like trains.
It's a wonderful day for pie...
When I go solo camping, I love lying down and watching the stars at night. Seeing them shine away from the lights of the big city is always so magical...
Since we're outside, why don't I take this time to share a few camping tips with you all? Maybe it'll make some of you want to give it a shot yourself!
While we're out her, do you mind if I share some camping tips with you all? Perhaps it'll get some of you interested in trying it out for yourselves!
~Blue_hair~, your hair looks really pretty. My friend Rin also has blue hair, though it's a fairly dark shade.

~Pink hair~, has anyone told you how cute your hair looks? Of course, I can't deny that I'm biased. Hoo hee hee!

~Criminal~, aren't you a... you know. You're not going to hurt me, are you?

Hey, ~food~, what you've got in your hand looks delicious! Do you think I could have a bite?
Would I be correct in saying that you're an avid reader, ~ddlc~? My friend Rin also really likes books. In fact, she worked in a bookshop in Yamanashi before she eventually headed off to college!
~Tsundere~, are you feeling okay? You don't seem to be in a good mood...
My friend Rin was the one who introduced me to camping. She enjoys camping on her own, and travels to different campsites on her little moped.
I met my friend Aoi when I first joined the Outclub. I would say she's really good at lying, but I'd be fibbing myself if that was true.
Chiaki, or Aki, as we all call her, is the self-appointed leader of the old Outclub. She was the one who always planned our trips and activities, and she certainly took pride in doing so.

My friend Ayano, or Aya-chan, as I call her, is a really chill person. We were childhood friends back when I lived in Hamanatsu, and she even camped with us when me and Rin went on our Ooi River trip!
Ena is one of Rin's old friends. She often enjoys the company of Chikuwa, her hairy chihuahua. She's got a bit of a cheeky side too, and loves to tie my friend Rin's hair bun into funny shapes.

When I was in the Outclub, our advisor was Toba Sensei. Me and Rin met her on Lake Shibire when she was camping with her sister. Despite her drinking habit, she's incredibly knowledgeable in regards to camping, and always willing to lend a helping hand!
Sakura is my older sister. She used to be very protective of me when I was younger. Her grip loosened as I got older, but she couldn't help shedding a tear when I left for college.

Many people have told me that they find camping difficult, because it's hard to live without the comforts of home, but I think that's part of the fun of it! It's not everyone's cup of tea, but being among nature can be very relaxing.

People at the outdoors shop I work at ask me how they can get started camping. I tell them that simply going car camping for the night can be a great way to get a feel for it, and then they can go from there however they'd like!

Whenever you're going on a camping trip, planning out your menu ahead of time, and gathering the necessary ingredients is crucial. At some campsites, the nearest grocery stores can be miles away, so coming prepared is always important.

Many people worry that outdoor cooking is incredibly difficult, but it doesn't have to be! Simply grilling some meat on a skewer, or cooking vegetables in foil are great ways to start, and then you can branch out from there!

Some people are hesitant to give winter camping a try because of the cold. While that's completely understandable, It's actually not bad. You've just got to be prepared. As long as you pack warm clothes, and have a warm tent and sleeping bag, you're pretty much good to go!

I often meet people who find camping to be quite boring. However, there are plenty of things to do! You can walk around the campsite, cook, read a book, draw, and, at lake campsites, you can even go fishing or boating! There's a lot of fun to be had in the great outdoors!

When packing for a camping trip, it's helpful to have a list of everyone you're going to need to take. Forgetting even the smallest items can lead a camper to disaster, so make sure to gather everything before heading out!

A lot of first-time campers tend to struggle with choosing a tent. A good tent is something that fits your needs as a camper. A good rule of thumb is to take the number of campers staying in a tent, and then add one to it, and that's how many people can comfortably fit in it.

I've encountered a number of amateur campers who think winter camping is no different than summer camping. However, both summer and winter camping have their own, unique challenges which requires different kinds of gear, such as bug spray or sunscreen for summer, or warm clothes for winter.

On occasion, I'll meet people who aren't sure what kind of wood to use in their campfires. Most campsites have bundles of firewood for sale, but if you want to gather your own, you have to find dry wood, because wet wood will either prevent your fire from burning, or cause the flames to pop.

I've met a lot of first-time campers who are unsure as to where they should go on their first trip. It depends on the kind of experience you want, but its important to do plenty of research beforehand to know where you're going, and what the temperatures are there, giving you a better idea of what to pack.

I've seen people who tend to stress about every aspect of a camping trip. However, What's most important is for you to relax and enjoy yourself! Take time to do things at your own pace, and I can guarantee you'll have a good trip!
Some people like to bring their pets with them when they go camping. However, not all pets are a fan of the cold, so consider bundling them up, or leaving them with a pet sitter at home.

When camping, choosing the right sleeping bag is important. Keep in mind that certain bags are better for different kinds of weather. Winter sleeping bags are thicker, keeping you toasty when you sleep!

There are three kinds of "standard" campsites, open field campsites, forest campsites, and my favorite, lake campsites! Which kind of site you choose to camp at is up to you, as each has their own pros and cons.

When me and my friends went camping, we would enjoy experiences outside the campsite, such as visiting a hot spring or a caf! If you plan accordingly, it can help to enhance your camping experience a lot!
I've had many first time campers ask me what actually counts as camping. Aside from tent camping, staying in an RV, or even a cabin can count! It's ultimately up to what you want to do!
Sometimes, you'll be forced to cut your own firewood while camping. When that happens, remember to take the necessary safety precautions, and keep other campers outside your work space.

Outdoor stores can be a great resource! Not just for buying supplies, but the staff are willing to give you tips and tricks for your next camping trip and help you find what gear works for your needs!
Oh, I should probably introduce myself: Nadeshiko Kagamihara, camping extraordinaire, at your service!
Oh! Before I forget, I should introduce myself! I'm Nadeshiko Kagamihara, camping extraordinaire! It's a pleasure to meet all of you!
This is a bar, right? Our club advisor, Toba-Sensei would love this place. She can guzzle a bottle of sak without any issue. She's honestly kind of scary when she's drunk sometimes.
I wonder if my friend Rin-chan would be interested in check this place out. Then again, she'd probably rather go solo camping on her moped.
Would my friend Aki-chan enjoy this place? She could use a break from her college studies learning tourism management.
I would ask my friend Ena-chan if she'd like to check this place out, but she'd probably want to go somewhere where she can take her dog Chikuwa with her.
Should I invite my friend Aoi-chan with me next time? I know studying to become a teacher is really stressful, and she could really use a good place to unwind.
You know, I haven't seen my friend Ayano in awhile. I wonder if she'd be interested in visiting the Inventory? She takes a lot of trips on her bike, so perhaps this would be a good place to visit.
~Player~, would you be interested in going camping with me sometime? It's been hard to find a friend to go with since I started college.
Would anyone like something to eat after the game? I'd be more than happy to grill some meat or roast some vegetables!

~Player~, you seem a little hungry. When I met my friend Rin for the first time, she gave me a cup of curry noodles to eat. I was so hungry, they tasted like heaven! Why don't I do the same for you? It's my treat.
(The thought of hopping into a nice, warm hot spring after this would be nice. It makes me feel all warm and cozy.)
(I could go for some Yakisoba right about now. A tasty blend of meat and vegetable, and stir-fried to perfection with some noodles in the mix!)
(The thought of seeing Mount Fuji again is really putting me at peace. Just seeing it across from Lake Motosu is such a magical sight!)
(After this, I wonder where I should go camping next? I should look up some locations after I'm done here!)

I recently started working at an outdoors store near my college. I really enjoy helping customers find camping gear and supplies! If any of you want to go camping, why not stop by? I'd be happy to assist!
I love meeting new people while I'm out camping. Getting to know people and talk to them is one of the best things about it! I guess meeting new people is part of the fun here too!
When my friend Rin first introduced me to camping, she showed me how to use pine cones to start a campfire. They're incredibly effective firestarters, and are incredibly useful in a pinch!
Ever since I started college, I haven't had much time to see my friends. We still keep in touch through text, but I have a feeling we'll get together one day though...
You know, my friends say that I sometimes act like a dear old lady. I can't imagine why they think that, but I guess, in life, things just sort of happen dear.
I've always wanted to experience camping in other places around the world. Getting to experience different cultures, new foods, and make new friends would be really exciting!
There are a lot of camping-related activities I've always wanted to try out. For instance, catching fresh fish and then cooking it over a fire sounds really appealing.

There are so many places around the world I'd love to camp at. For instance, there are a number of camping hotspots in the United States I'd love to visit, especially Colorado. The sight of rivers running along rocky cliffsides really capture the imagination!
I've always wanted to try playing songs around a campfire! I've been looking to buy a harmonica and learn to play, but college classes don't exactly afford me that luxury.

Whenever I go camping, I'm always in awe of the natural beauty around me. Somebody once called it "Nature's Wonderland", and it's not hard to see why! That's part of the joy of being in the great outdoors!
Aside from camping and cooking, I've also come to really love trains. I travel on a lot of trains to travel to the campsites I visit, and I find riding on them to be so much fun!
Do any of you have a favorite place you enjoy visiting time and time again? For me, that's easily Lake Motosu and Mount Fuji. There's something truly magical about seeing it from across the lake...
Despite all the outdoor activities I've done, I'll admit that I'm not much much of a hiker. I've walked the campsite pathways and the occasional nature trail, but not much beyond that.
I've always found it really to cool to talk to people about their hobbies, especially when they're as passionate about them as I am about camping. The passion you hear in their voices is amazing!
It feels really nice to take a break from the hustle and bustle from Tokyo for awhile. I've been attending college there, and while it is nice, all the activity can be draining.
Everything and anything tastes good to me, but my favorite is curry noodles!
I hope you're having a great day today, ~player~. Isn't it nice to unwind after a long, busy day?
One of my favorite parts of camping is getting to admire the beautiful views. There's something so captivating about seeing Mount Fuji from across Lake Motosu, or city lights from a mountainside.
Remember to be kind to yourself, ~player~. remember to relax and take it easy every once in awhile, and take some time to do the things you enjoy most in life.
So, I was curious: When it comes to finding partners, do you prefer personality, or looks? I personally like someone sweet, like... Well, I'll leave it at that. Ehehe.
Just always smile and seize the day...
Yuru, Yuru Yuru...
Shiny Days...
Filled with love...
I'm home again...
The sun is coming up...
I'm just going my way...
...Sunrise is waiting for us!

Since I've started camping, I've learned a wide variety of camping tips that I've found to be really useful! If you all are okay with it, I'll share some of them with you!
Most people don't know this about me, but I'm a really good cook! In fact, I prepare a lot of meals for myself at home! It not only can save you money over going out, but it's a lot healthier too!
A lot of people are surprised when I tell them this, but I actually do my own cooking. Not just on camping trips, but also at home. I find it rewarding to eat a meal you've cooked yourself!
A lot of people know that I'm a big eater, but I'm also a really good cook! I've cooked on both camping trips, and at home! Cooking's not only fun, but it's also healthy, and rewarding!
